verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm of David,<WH1732> the servant<WH5650> of the LORD,<WH3068> who<WH834> spoke<WH1696> unto the LORD<WH3068> <WH853> the words<WH1697> of this<WH2063> song<WH7892> in the day<WH3117> that the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5337> him from the hand<WH4480> <WH3709> of all<WH3605> his enemies,<WH341> and from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of Saul:<WH7586> And he said,<WH559> I will love<WH7355> thee, O LORD,<WH3068> my strength.<WH2391>

The LORD<WH3068> is my rock,<WH5553> and my fortress,<WH4686> and my deliverer;<WH6403> my God,<WH410> my strength,<WH6697> in whom I will trust;<WH2620> my buckler,<WH4043> and the horn<WH7161> of my salvation,<WH3468> and my high tower.<WH4869>
I will call<WH7121> upon the LORD,<WH3068> who is worthy to be praised:<WH1984> so shall I be saved<WH3467> from<WH4480> mine enemies.<WH341>
The sorrows<WH2256> of death<WH4194> compassed<WH661> me, and the floods<WH5158> of ungodly men<WH1100> made me afraid.<WH1204>
The sorrows<WH2256> of hell<WH7585> compassed me about:<WH5437> the snares<WH4170> of death<WH4194> prevented<WH6923> me.

In my distress<WH6862> I called upon<WH7121> the LORD,<WH3068> and cried<WH7768> unto<WH413> my God:<WH430> he heard<WH8085> my voice<WH6963> out of his temple,<WH4480> <WH1964> and my cry<WH7775> came<WH935> before<WH6440> him, even into his ears.<WH241>
Then the earth<WH776> shook<WH1607> and trembled;<WH7493> the foundations<WH4146> also of the hills<WH2022> moved<WH7264> and were shaken,<WH1607> because<WH3588> he was wroth.<WH2734>
There went up<WH5927> a smoke<WH6227> out of his nostrils,<WH639> and fire<WH784> out of his mouth<WH4480> <WH6310> devoured:<WH398> coals<WH1513> were kindled<WH1197> by<WH4480> it.
He bowed<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> also, and came down:<WH3381> and darkness<WH6205> was under<WH8478> his feet.<WH7272>
And he rode<WH7392> upon<WH5921> a cherub,<WH3742> and did fly:<WH5774> yea, he did fly<WH1675> upon<WH5921> the wings<WH3671> of the wind.<WH7307>
He made<WH7896> darkness<WH2824> his secret place;<WH5643> his pavilion<WH5521> round about<WH5439> him were dark<WH2824> waters<WH4325> and thick clouds<WH5645> of the skies.<WH7834>
At the brightness<WH4480> <WH5051> that was before<WH5048> him his thick clouds<WH5645> passed,<WH5674> hail<WH1259> stones and coals<WH1513> of fire.<WH784>
The LORD<WH3068> also thundered<WH7481> in the heavens,<WH8064> and the Highest<WH5945> gave<WH5414> his voice;<WH6963> hail<WH1259> stones and coals<WH1513> of fire.<WH784>
Yea, he sent out<WH7971> his arrows,<WH2671> and scattered<WH6327> them; and he shot out<WH7232> lightnings,<WH1300> and discomfited<WH2000> them.

Then the channels<WH650> of waters<WH4325> were seen,<WH7200> and the foundations<WH4146> of the world<WH8398> were discovered<WH1540> at thy rebuke,<WH4480> <WH1606> O LORD,<WH3068> at the blast<WH4480> <WH5397> of the breath<WH7307> of thy nostrils.<WH639>
He sent<WH7971> from above,<WH4480> <WH4791> he took<WH3947> me, he drew<WH4871> me out of many waters.<WH4480> <WH4325> <WH7227>
He delivered<WH5337> me from my strong<WH5794> enemy,<WH4480> <WH341> and from them which hated<WH4480> <WH8130> me: for<WH3588> they were too strong<WH553> for<WH4480> me.
They prevented<WH6923> me in the day<WH3117> of my calamity:<WH343> but the LORD<WH3068> was<WH1961> my stay.<WH4937>
He brought me forth<WH3318> also into a large place;<WH4800> he delivered<WH2502> me, because<WH3588> he delighted<WH2654> in me.
The LORD<WH3068> rewarded<WH1580> me according to my righteousness;<WH6664> according to the cleanness<WH1252> of my hands<WH3027> hath he recompensed<WH7725> me.
For <WH3588> I have kept<WH8104> the ways<WH1870> of the LORD,<WH3068> and have not<WH3808> wickedly departed<WH7561> from my God.<WH4480> <WH430>
For <WH3588> all<WH3605> his judgments<WH4941> were before<WH5048> me, and I did not<WH3808> put away<WH5493> his statutes<WH2708> from<WH4480> me.
I was<WH1961> also upright<WH8549> before<WH5973> him, and I kept myself<WH8104> from mine iniquity.<WH4480> <WH5771>
Therefore hath the LORD<WH3068> recompensed<WH7725> me according to my righteousness,<WH6664> according to the cleanness<WH1252> of my hands<WH3027> in<WH5048> his eyesight.<WH5869>
With <WH5973> the merciful<WH2623> thou wilt show thyself merciful;<WH2616> with<WH5973> an upright<WH8549> man<WH1399> thou wilt show thyself upright;<WH8552>
With <WH5973> the pure<WH1305> thou wilt show thyself pure;<WH1305> and with<WH5973> the froward<WH6141> thou wilt show thyself froward.<WH6617>
For <WH3588> thou wilt<WH859> save<WH3467> the afflicted<WH6041> people;<WH5971> but wilt bring down<WH8213> high<WH7311> looks.<WH5869>
For <WH3588> thou<WH859> wilt light<WH215> my candle:<WH5216> the LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430> will enlighten<WH5050> my darkness.<WH2822>
For <WH3588> by thee I have run through<WH7323> a troop;<WH1416> and by my God<WH430> have I leaped over<WH1801> a wall.<WH7791>
As for God,<WH410> his way<WH1870> is perfect:<WH8549> the word<WH565> of the LORD<WH3068> is tried:<WH6884> he<WH1931> is a buckler<WH4043> to all<WH3605> those that trust<WH2620> in him.
For <WH3588> who<WH4310> is God<WH433> save<WH4480> <WH1107> the LORD?<WH3068> or who<WH4310> is a rock<WH6697> save<WH2108> our God?<WH430>
It is God<WH410> that girdeth<WH247> me with strength,<WH2428> and maketh<WH5414> my way<WH1870> perfect.<WH8549>
He maketh<WH7737> my feet<WH7272> like hinds'<WH355> feet, and setteth<WH5975> me upon<WH5921> my high places.<WH1116>
He teacheth<WH3925> my hands<WH3027> to war,<WH4421> so that a bow<WH7198> of steel<WH5154> is broken<WH5181> by mine arms.<WH2220>
Thou hast also given<WH5414> me the shield<WH4043> of thy salvation:<WH3468> and thy right hand<WH3225> hath holden me up,<WH5582> and thy gentleness<WH6038> hath made me great.<WH7235>
Thou hast enlarged<WH7337> my steps<WH6806> under<WH8478> me, that my feet<WH7166> did not<WH3808> slip.<WH4571>
I have pursued<WH7291> mine enemies,<WH341> and overtaken<WH5381> them: neither<WH3808> did I turn again<WH7725> till<WH5704> they were consumed.<WH3615>
I have wounded<WH4272> them that they were not<WH3808> able<WH3201> to rise:<WH6965> they are fallen<WH5307> under<WH8478> my feet.<WH7272>
For thou hast girded<WH247> me with strength<WH2428> unto the battle:<WH4421> thou hast subdued<WH3766> under<WH8478> me those that rose up<WH6965> against me.
Thou hast also given<WH5414> me the necks<WH6203> of mine enemies;<WH341> that I might destroy<WH6789> them that hate<WH8130> me.
They cried,<WH7768> but there was none<WH369> to save<WH3467> them: even unto<WH5921> the LORD,<WH3068> but he answered<WH6030> them not.<WH3808>
Then did I beat them small<WH7833> as the dust<WH6083> before<WH5921> <WH6440> the wind:<WH7307> I did cast them out<WH7324> as the dirt<WH2916> in the streets.<WH2351>

Thou hast delivered<WH6403> me from the strivings<WH4480> <WH7379> of the people;<WH5971> and thou hast made<WH7760> me the head<WH7218> of the heathen:<WH1471> a people<WH5971> whom I have not<WH3808> known<WH3045> shall serve<WH5647> me.
As soon as they hear<WH8088> <WH241> of me, they shall obey<WH8085> me: the strangers<WH1121> <WH5236> shall submit<WH3584> themselves unto me.
The strangers<WH1121> <WH5236> shall fade away,<WH5034> and be afraid<WH2727> out of<WH4480> their close places.<WH4526>
The LORD<WH3068> liveth;<WH2416> and blessed<WH1288> be my rock;<WH6697> and let the God<WH430> of my salvation<WH3468> be exalted.<WH7311>
It is God<WH410> that avengeth<WH5414> <WH5360> me, and subdueth<WH1696> the people<WH5971> under<WH8478> me.

He delivereth<WH6403> me from mine enemies:<WH4480> <WH341> yea,<WH637> thou liftest me up<WH7311> above<WH4480> those that rise up<WH6965> against me: thou hast delivered<WH5337> me from the violent<WH2555> man.<WH4480> <WH376>
Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> will I give thanks<WH3034> unto thee, O LORD,<WH3068> among the heathen,<WH1471> and sing praises<WH2167> unto thy name.<WH8034>
Great <WH1431> deliverance<WH3444> giveth he to his king;<WH4428> and showeth<WH6213> mercy<WH2617> to his anointed,<WH4899> to David,<WH1732> and to his seed<WH2233> forevermore.<WH5704> <WH5769>
